meta.title: Daily Page — About
meta.description: What Daily Page is, how it works, and why it was built as a slower, kinder corner of the web.

about.title: About Daily Page
about.tagline: Feed your mind, not your feed.

mission.p1: An indie writing lab—started in my living room, fueled by reader curiosity.
mission.p2: It’s built not to rot your brain, but to nourish it: a place where you can write slowly, anonymously if you like, and never worry about impressing anyone.

blocks.label: Blocks
blocks.text: are collaborative posts—anyone (even “anonymous”) can create one, edit it until it’s locked, and vote on others.

privacy.label: Privacy & Sharing
privacy.text: Public blocks live in the room’s feed. Private blocks hide until locked, but you get a share-link to invite friends.

markdown.label: Markdown & Media
markdown.text: You write in markdown, embed images, and co-edit like in Google Docs.

trends.label: Trends & Tags
trends.text: Tag your block, track tag trends, and discover top content (7 d / 30 d / all-time).

streaks.label: Streaks
streaks.text: Keep your daily writing streak alive—your best incentive to show up each day.

origin.p1: In 2018, I built a date-based wiki for “today’s page” and watched a few introspective writers turn it into an outlet for their thoughts. It never got huge—but it planted a seed.
origin.p2: Fast-forward to now, and Daily Page is that seed grown into many rooms—a quiet social web for introverts, idealists, and anyone craving a slower pace.

next.p1: We’re just getting started: richer embeds, deeper user stats, reputation leaderboards, and more ways to reward thoughtful creation.
next.p2: Thank you for being part of this little indie experiment.
